medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Acute onset of abdominal pain for 1 day, beginning the previous evening. The pain is constant and worsening, localized to the lower abdomen with radiation to the lower right quadrant and umbilical area as of the morning. Associated symptoms include nausea, dry heaving, and anorexia. Denies fever, chills, dysuria, chest pain, or shortness of breath.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past surgical history includes inguinal hernia repair as an infant. No other relevant medical history specified.
